metadata.intent: Establish master definition for character 'ACT THREE'

data.description: ACT THREE is a structural/narrative marker within the script, functioning as a scene or act divider rather than a human character. It appears at the end of the provided scene content as a title card signaling the transition from Act Two to Act Three of the story. It has no physical presence, dialogue, or personality traits of its own.
data.dialogue_summary: ACT THREE has no dialogue. Its sole appearance is as a structural act-break label at the end of the scene, marking the transition point in the screenplay's three-act structure.

explicit_evidence.quote:
